oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Veterans; Military standards; Reunions; Group portraits
Confederate States of America - History; United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Lawerence County (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lawrence County Confederate veterans gathered for a reunion. They are flanked by a flag and two unidentified women. John Booker Kennedy (first row, second from left) is included in the photograph.

John Booker Kennedy, born in Giles County but residing in Lawrence County after the war, served as a private in Company A of the 3rd Tennessee Infantry and was one of the six original organizers of the Ku Klux Klan in Pulaski.
